headline: Why AT&T Stock Jumped Today
summary: AT&T stock got a lift from Verizon's recently published second-quarter report.  Verizon published Q2 sales and earnings that beat the market's expectations.  AT&T reports earnings tomorrow, and investors think that Verizon's recent performance is a positive indicator.

headline: Verizon’s Postpaid Phone Losses Continue, Full-Year Forecast Improves
summary: Verizon Communications  raised its earnings forecast for the year, but lost lucrative postpaid phone customers for the second consecutive quarter.  Verizon lost a net 9,000 postpaid phone connections in the latest quarter, missing analyst expectations that it would add a net new 13,000 connections.  In the year-ago quarter, Verizon added 148,000 postpaid phone connections.

raw.headline: Verizon’s Postpaid Phone Losses Continue, Full-Year Forecast Improves
raw.summary: Verizon Communications  raised its earnings forecast for the year, but lost lucrative postpaid phone customers for the second consecutive quarter.  Verizon lost a net 9,000 postpaid phone connections in the latest quarter, missing analyst expectations that it would add a net new 13,000 connections.  In the year-ago quarter, Verizon added 148,000 postpaid phone connections.

headline: Verizon's Premium Plans Drive Higher Profit Projections After Solid Quarter
summary: Verizon Communications (NYSE: VZ) stock gained on Monday after the company reported better-than-expected second-quarter financial results and raised guidance. The company reported quarterly revenue growth was 5.2% year-over-year (Y/Y), reaching $34.50 billion, topping the analyst consensus estimate of $33.57 billion, driven by its broad wireless and broadband offerings across market segments. Adjusted EPS of $1.22 topped the analyst consensus estimate of $1.19. The company boosted retention and

headline: Verizon Earnings Push the Stock Higher. Why the Market Loves the Results.
summary: Verizon Communications  beat Wall Street’s earnings expectations and hiked its 2025 earnings and free cash flow guidance on Monday, sending the stock higher.  The wireless carrier reported adjusted quarterly earnings of $1.22 per share, as revenue climbed 5.2% from a year ago to $34.5 billion.  Verizon said that a strong performance over the first half of the year, coupled with favorable tax reforms, meant it was raising its 2025 earnings guidance.

raw.headline: Verizon Earnings Push the Stock Higher. Why the Market Loves the Results.
raw.summary: Verizon Communications  beat Wall Street’s earnings expectations and hiked its 2025 earnings and free cash flow guidance on Monday, sending the stock higher.  The wireless carrier reported adjusted quarterly earnings of $1.22 per share, as revenue climbed 5.2% from a year ago to $34.5 billion.  Verizon said that a strong performance over the first half of the year, coupled with favorable tax reforms, meant it was raising its 2025 earnings guidance.

headline: Verizon (NYSE:VZ) Surprises With Q2 Sales
summary: Telecommunications giant Verizon (NYSE:VZ) reported Q2 CY2025 results beating Wall Street’s revenue expectations, with sales up 5.2% year on year to $34.5 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.22 per share was 2.6% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
